definitions.definition: a drawing that shows information in a simple way, often using lines and curves to show amounts:
examples: There is a chart on the classroom wall showing the relative heights of all the children.

definitions.definition: a detailed map of an area of water:
to show something on a chart:
examples: We need some sort of graph on which we can chart our progress.

definitions.definition: to watch something with careful attention or to record something in detail:
examples: A global study has just been started to chart the effects of climate change.

definitions.definition: to arrange a plan of action:
examples: The local branch of the party is meeting to chart their election campaign.
